greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: ATS: Add Then Sort (i.e., double previous term and then sort digits).
comment: Starting from a(1)=1 sequence cycles starting from a(25) = 48889, 77789, 155578, 111356, 122227, 244445, 48889, ... etc.
example: a(8)=29 since a(7)=46, 46 + 46 = 92 and 92 sorted is 29.
xref: Cf. A033861 for STA, A004000 for RATS.

The following are parallel families: A000079 (2^n), A004094 (2^n reversed), A028909 (2^n sorted up), A028910 (2^n sorted down), A036447 (double and reverse), A057615 (double and sort up), A263451 (double and sort down); A000244 (3^n), A004167 (3^n reversed), A321540 (3^n sorted up), A321539 (3^n sorted down), A163632 (triple and reverse), A321542 (triple and sort up), A321541 (triple and sort down).
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Oct 09 2000
